result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay court costs, fees, asessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaining balance upon release to Extended Supervision shall be due immediately.   Failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count three, and consecutive to 14CF1547 and any other senence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, ammunition or holster.
No possession of any alcohol.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use., manufacturing, delivery or distribution.
No more than $150.00 cash (coins or bills) at one time.
Comply with paying DOC supevision fees.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfuly complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting. 
Court advised the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Exended supervison and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Motion to Vacate DNA Surcharges, received, signed and filed.  Copies mailed to the parties.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion to vacate DNA surcharges (denominated as "Motion for a Return of Property to Defendant - Companion Writ of Habeas Corpus."
Original Transcript (44 pages) commencing 10/24/2014 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F. Klimetz.  Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Ricky B. 
AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, concurrent to Count 3 and consecutive to 14CF1547 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
AS TO COUNT 3: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, concurrent to Count 2 and consecutive to 14CF1547 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Deefendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, ammunition or holster.
- No possession of any alcohol. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivery, or distribution. 
- No more than $150.00 cash (coins or bills) at one time.
- Maintain full time work. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with paying Department of Correction Supervision fees. 
- DNA sample, if not already provided. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending Sentencing.

Attorney Frederick F. Klimetz in court, defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl for Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court due to the Justice Point Status Update received 9-26-2014 in case 14CF1547. For the reasons placed on the record the Court Orders the Defendant Remanded and withholds decision on any signature bond or cash bond. 
Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 10-24-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F. Klimetz.  Patricia I. Daugherty for Karyn Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is scheduled for Sentencing Hearing. Due to the reasons placed on the record Court orders the case adjourned for Sentencing on 10-24-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F. Klimetz.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was scheduled for Final Pretrial.   Defendant changes pleas to No Contest. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court orders the Jury Trial scheduled for 08/20/2014, vacated.
Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing 9/5/2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 15, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Parties advised effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, Room 313 safety building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with court.
Due to death in family Defense will not be able to appear tomorrow afternoon for the Scheduling Conference.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case consolidated with 14CF1547.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zachary Leevaice Bryant in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  FOR BRANCH 15.  Court grants State's motion for consolidation with 14CF1547.  Parties to investigate local rule for which court shall hear these matters.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-30-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
